creator: dev@tomcat.apache.org
text: Javadoc should also be able to exclude packages like javac.  Since Javadoc expects compilable code, and there may be junk packages in your path, the ability to exclude those packages would allow Javadoc to work in a greater number of enviornments.

With recent changes to the way the Javadoc task determines which packages
to document, adding an excludespackagenames attribute (that has the same 
syntax as the packagenames attribute) was straightforward.
creator: glennm@apache.org
